title: IK Sleipner
text:
Idrottsklubben Sleipner is a <a href="sports">sports</a> club in <a href="Norrk%C3%B6ping">Norrköping</a>, <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a>; the main sports are <a href="Association%20football">football</a> and <a href="ten-pin%20bowling">ten-pin bowling</a>. It was founded in 1903, and named after the deity <a href="Odin">Odin</a>'s horse <a href="Sleipnir">Sleipnir</a> from <a href="Norse%20mythology">Norse mythology</a>. Currently, the club's senior men's team plays football in <a href="Swedish%20Football%20Division%202%20%C3%96stra%20G%C3%B6taland">Division 2</a>. They are mostly known for winning <a href="Allsvenskan">Allsvenskan</a> in 1938, but have since been overshadowed by local rivals <a href="IFK%20Norrk%C3%B6ping">IFK Norrköping</a> both locally and nationally. The rivalry in beginning 1900 up until 1950 was often fierce as IK Sleipner was the workingclass team whilst IFK Norrköping came from the academical class. The club is affiliated to the <a href="%C3%96sterg%C3%B6tlands%20Fotbollf%C3%B6rbund">Östergötlands Fotbollförbund</a>. In the early 20th Century, the club also played <a href="bandy">bandy</a>. also the record holders of most goalscorers in one game against Cuba in 1938 with 7 goals.
